mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Guadalupiidae likely possessed basic mechanoreception to detect water flow and physical disturbances. This is inferred from the general sensory capabilities of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water. This is inferred from the general sensory capabilities of sponges.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Guadalupiidae is currently unknown. Sponges do not typically have complex eyes, but some species have light-sensitive cells.
